title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2023 that cover indirect supervision in the context of machine learning (ML
container-title: and natural language processing (NLP), with a focus on learning using incidental signals such as partial labels, noisy labels, and cross-domain annotation

title: **"Learning from Noisy Labels with Deep Neural Networks: A Survey"**
note: Xiaobo Xia, Tongliang Liu, Bo Han, Nannan Wang, Mingming Gong, Haifeng Liu, Gang Niu, Masashi Sugiyama (2020

title: A comprehensive survey on methods to handle noisy labels in deep learning
**"Weakly Supervised Learning for Natural Language Processing"** - Yue Zhang, Jie Yang
An overview of weakly supervised learning techniques in NLP
**"Learning with Noisy Labels Revisited: A Study Using Real-World Human Annotations"** - Jacob Goldberger, Ehud Ben-Reuven
An empirical study on learning with noisy labels using real-world data
**"Cross-Domain Sentiment Classification with Auxiliary Data Selection"**
Techniques for cross-domain sentiment classification using auxiliary data
**"Learning from Partial Labels with Generative Adversarial Networks"**
Using GANs to learn from partial labels
**"Robust Training under Label Noise by Over-parameterization"**
Discusses robust training methods under label noise
**"Learning from Noisy Labels with Self-Ensembling"** - Mehdi Sajjadi, Mehran Javanmardi, Tolga Tasdizen
Self-ensembling techniques to handle noisy labels
**"Cross-Domain Text Classification with Multiple Sources"** - Sinno Jialin Pan
Methods for cross-domain text classification using multiple sources
